intro: Erinus tristis, commonly known as the weeping erinus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, pale blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in mild climates. Erinus tristis is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
